alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 1:45PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern San Diego County through 230 PM PDT... At 145 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, or 7 miles west of Borrego Springs, moving south at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Warner Springs, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Ranchita, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel And Warner Springs, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Banner, Shelter Valley and Wynola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains
